transitHacks.title: Suica/Pasmo
transitHacks.description: Get a rechargeable IC card at any station. Works on trains, buses, and many convenience stores. Tap in and out—no need to buy single tickets.

transitHacks.title: Rush-hour gaps
transitHacks.description: Avoid the Yamanote Line 7–9am and 5–7pm. Use the Chuo or Sobu lines for slightly less crowding, or travel just before/after peaks.

transitHacks.title: Quiet carriages
transitHacks.description: Many lines have "women-only" cars during rush hours (marked on the platform). General riders should avoid phone calls and loud conversations in all cars.

localEtiquette.title: Train manners
localEtiquette.description: Keep bags on your lap or in overhead racks. Don’t eat or drink on most trains. Priority seats are for elderly, pregnant, and disabled passengers.
do: Stand on the left on escalators (Tokyo)
dont: Eat or drink on local trains

localEtiquette.title: Tipping
localEtiquette.description: Tipping is not customary in Japan. It can even cause confusion. Excellent service is the norm without extra payment.

transitHacks.title: Navigo Découverte
transitHacks.description: Weekly pass (Mon–Sun) for zones 1–5. Bring a photo; you’ll need it to validate the pass. Cheaper than daily tickets if you’re staying 4+ days.

transitHacks.title: RATP app
transitHacks.description: Use the official RATP app for real-time Métro, RER, and bus info. Offline maps available—download before you go.

transitHacks.title: Avoid strike days
transitHacks.description: Check for grèves (strikes) on RATP or SNCF. On strike days, expect reduced service; have backup plans (walking, Bolt, etc.).

localEtiquette.title: Greetings
localEtiquette.description: Always say "Bonjour" when entering a shop or café. "Bonsoir" after dark. Skipping it is considered rude.
dont: Eat while walking in nice areas

localEtiquette.title: Dining
localEtiquette.description: Meals are leisurely. Don’t ask for the check too quickly—it can feel like you’re being rushed out.
do: Keep hands on the table (wrists visible)
dont: Order café au lait with dinner
